intro: Peristylus hollandiae, commonly known as the Dutch peristylus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that come in shades of red and orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by birds, particularly sunbirds, due to their shape and nectar-rich structure. Peristylus hollandiae is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained, sunny conditions.
